cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north-northeast inland over Louisiana and western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (near the Houma / Intracoastal City – Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA (east of the TX-LA border)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River, including metropolitan New Orleans; Storm-Surge Warning: Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA eastward to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana and Mississippi coastlines with lesser effects extending westward to Sabine Pass TX and eastward to coastal Alabama
weather_observation.wind: There is a 35–37% chance of experiencing sustained tropical-storm-force (≥39 mph) winds, with peak gusts possibly 40–45 mph Sunday night into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible around Sabine Pass and the Port Arthur area at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 2–4 inches of rain; widespread 4-inch totals are not currently expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk from outer rainbands Sunday night into Monday; elevated seas and rough surf could impact vessel movements in the approaches to Sabine Pass.
